description: A powerful VSCode extension that provides comprehensive assistance for MyBatis developers, significantly improving development efficiency.
command.toggleLogInterceptor.title: Toggle Log Interceptor
command.showSqlOutput.title: Show SQL Output
command.clearSqlHistory.title: Clear SQL History
command.jumpToXml.title: Jump to XML
command.jumpToMapper.title: Jump to Mapper
command.refreshMappings.title: Refresh Mappings
command.refreshData.title: Refresh Data
command.testUIDisplay.title: Test UI Display
configuration.title: MyBatis Helper Configuration
configuration.databaseType.description: Database type for SQL formatting and syntax highlighting. Supported values: mysql, oracle, sqlserver, postgresql
configuration.enableLogInterceptor.descr: Enable SQL log interceptor to capture and display SQL statements from console logs in real-time
configuration.customLogPattern.descripti: Custom regular expression pattern for parsing SQL statements from logs. Use this if the default pattern doesn't match your log format
configuration.maxHistorySize.description: Maximum number of SQL history entries to keep. Valid range: 10-1000
configuration.showExecutionTime.descript: Display SQL execution time in the output panel, helping you identify performance bottlenecks
configuration.batchProcessDelay.descript: Delay time in milliseconds for batch processing logs. Adjust this value to balance between responsiveness and performance
configuration.enableCodeLens.description: Enable CodeLens annotations in Java Mapper interfaces and XML files for quick navigation between them
configuration.fileOpenMode.description: File open mode when jumping between files. Options: useExisting (use existing tab if available), noSplit (always open in current editor group), alwaysSplit (always open in new editor group)
configuration.customXmlDirectories.descr: Custom XML directories to search for mapper files, relative to workspace root. Example: ["src/main/resources/mappers", "src/main/resources/xml"]
configuration.logOutputLevel.description: Log output level for plugin internal logs. Options: info (general information), debug (detailed debugging information)
configuration.nameMatchingRules.descript: Custom name matching rules for mapping Java Mapper interfaces to XML files. Rules are processed in order, with the first matching rule being used
configuration.nameMatchingRules.defaultM: Default rule for matching Mapper interfaces. Example: UserMapper.java -> User.xml
configuration.nameMatchingRules.defaultD: Default rule for matching DAO interfaces. Example: UserDao.java -> User.xml
configuration.nameMatchingRules.standard: Standard rule for matching any Java interface to XML file. Example: User.java -> User.xml
configuration.nameMatchingRules.item.nam: Rule name for identification and organization
configuration.nameMatchingRules.item.ena: Whether the rule is enabled or disabled. Only enabled rules are applied
configuration.nameMatchingRules.item.jav: Java file name pattern with wildcard support (*). Example: *Mapper matches UserMapper, RoleMapper
configuration.nameMatchingRules.item.xml: XML file name pattern with wildcard support (*) and ${javaName} variable. Example: ${javaName} matches UserMapper -> UserMapper.xml
configuration.nameMatchingRules.item.des: Description of what the rule does and when to use it
configuration.ignoreSuffixes.description: Suffixes to ignore when matching Java file names with XML files. Example: ["Mapper", "Dao"] means UserMapper.java matches User.xml instead of UserMapper.xml
configuration.pathPriority.description: Path priority configuration for file matching. Control which directories are searched first and which are excluded
configuration.pathPriority.enabled.descr: Enable path priority sorting to prioritize certain directories when searching for files
configuration.pathPriority.priorityDirec: Directories with higher priority. Files in these directories are matched first. Example: ["/src/", "/main/"]
configuration.pathPriority.excludeDirect: Directories to exclude from search. Example: ["/build/", "/target/"]
